Context Sentence JP: リンゴのしゅうかくりょうが全国で一ばん多いけんはどこですか？
Context Sentence EN: Which prefecture is the largest producer of apples nationwide?

Context Sentence JP: 彼は全国規模のサイバーいじめのスキャンダルに関与していた。
Context Sentence EN: He was involved in a nationwide cyber bullying scandal.

Context Sentence JP: 四国にはまだ行ったことがありません。
Context Sentence EN: I still haven’t been to Shikoku.

Context Sentence JP: 四国での生活にはなれましたか？
Context Sentence EN: Have you gotten used to life in Shikoku yet?

Context Sentence EN: I was traveling through Shikoku to learn how to make the best udon noodles.

Context Sentence JP: わたしたちはまだ外国に行ったことがありません。
Context Sentence EN: We haven’t gone to other countries yet.

Context Sentence JP: 外国へでんわをするのはこれがはじめてです。
Context Sentence EN: This is my first time making an overseas call.

Context Sentence JP: もし外国にいるなら、有名人になっても構わない。
Context Sentence EN: I wouldn’t mind being a celebrity if I was in a foreign country.

Context Sentence JP: 今日、外国人の友だちと、かいものに行きました。
Context Sentence EN: Today, I went shopping with my foreign friends.

Context Sentence JP: その外国人の目は血走っていた。
Context Sentence EN: That foreigner's eyes were bloodshot.

Context Sentence JP: いいえ、私は人種差別主義者ではありません。世界中の全ての外国人に会って、それぞれ個人的に嫌いになっただけです。
Context Sentence EN: No, I’m not racist. I’ve met every kind of foreign person on the planet and I just hate each of them equally.

Meaning: United States Of America, United States, America, USA
Context Sentence JP: 米国の大とうりょうの名まえを知っていますか。
Context Sentence EN: Do you know the name of the president of the United States?

Meaning: United States Of America, United States, America, USA
Context Sentence JP: 米国には元々何もきたいなんてしてなかったよ。
Context Sentence EN: I never expected anything from the US anyways.

Meaning: United States Of America, United States, America, USA
Context Sentence JP: 多くの人は、単にマクドナルドのスーパーサイズコンボのために米国に移住する。
Context Sentence EN: Many people immigrate to the United States solely for the super-size combos at McDonald’s.

Context Sentence JP: きのうの夜、パーティーに行きました。
Context Sentence EN: I went to a party last night.

Context Sentence JP: きのうの夜は、こうふんしてほとんどねむれませんでした。
Context Sentence EN: Last night, I was so excited that I barely slept.

Context Sentence JP: 夜には、モンスターたちが床から這い上がり、私のベッドの下でお茶会を開くんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: Night is the time when monsters crawl up through the floor to have tea parties under my bed.

Context Sentence JP: 今夜、いっしょにのみに行きませんか。
Context Sentence EN: Would you like to go out for drinks with me tonight?

Context Sentence JP: 明日しけんがあるから、今夜はてつ夜でがんばります。
Context Sentence EN: The exam is coming up tomorrow, so I am gonna burn the midnight oil tonight.

Context Sentence JP: 今夜は晩ご飯に手羽先が食べたい気分だ。
Context Sentence EN: I feel like eating chicken wings for dinner tonight.

Context Sentence JP: 二人の姉妹はとてもよくにています。
Context Sentence EN: Those two sisters look so alike.

Context Sentence JP: 何か、二人って姉妹みたいだよね。
Context Sentence EN: Hey, you two kinda look like sisters.

Context Sentence JP: 単なる女友達には無い絆が、姉妹の間にはある。
Context Sentence EN: There is a bond between sisters that isn’t shared between girls who are just friends.

Context Sentence EN: Who is Tanaka’s younger sister?

Context Sentence JP: 妹にうら切られた気分です。
Context Sentence EN: I feel betrayed by my little sister.

Context Sentence JP: 私の妹は、バービー人形にウィッグを作ってあげたいからと、自分の髪の毛を切った。
Context Sentence EN: My younger sister just cut off all of her hair so she could make wigs for her Barbie dolls.

Context Sentence JP: みどりちゃんのお姉さんはめがねをかけています。
Context Sentence EN: Midori’s older sister is wearing glasses.

Context Sentence JP: あなたのこと、てっきりビエトくんのお姉さんだと思ってたんですが、ちがったんですね。
Context Sentence EN: I totally thought you were Viet's older sister, but you aren't, eh?

Context Sentence JP: 私のお姉さんは、バイクを買うことが彼氏を見つけることに繋がると考えています。
Context Sentence EN: My older sister thinks that buying a motorcycle will help her get a boyfriend.

Context Sentence JP: えきからその店までの地図をかいてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please draw a map from the station to the store.

Context Sentence JP: この店は年内はすでにずっとよやくでいっぱいだ。
Context Sentence EN: The restaurant is already fully booked for the rest of the year.

Context Sentence JP: この店のこと絶対気に入るぜ。世界一うまいミートローフがあるんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: You’re going to love this shop. They have the best meatloaf in the world.

Context Sentence JP: このへやは明るい。
Context Sentence EN: This room is bright.

Context Sentence JP: トーフグのみんなは明るい。
Context Sentence EN: Everyone at Tofugu is cheerful.

Context Sentence JP: 未来はまだまだ明るいよ、おじいちゃん。
Context Sentence EN: Your future is still bright, Grandpa.

Context Sentence JP: このはなしの作しゃは不明です。
Context Sentence EN: The author of this story is unknown.

Context Sentence JP: この牛にゅうのしょうみきげんは不明です。
Context Sentence EN: This milk doesn't have an expiration date on it.

Context Sentence JP: え？寝る時、玉ねぎを枕にしたの？あんたの言ってること、意味不明なんだけど。
Context Sentence EN: Huh? When you were sleeping you used an onion for a pillow? I don’t really get what you’re saying.

Context Sentence JP: この男は、東方の国から来たらしい。
Context Sentence EN: Apparently this man is from a country in the East.

Context Sentence JP: その宝は、東方の地のどこかにあるそうだ。
Context Sentence EN: The treasure is said to be somewhere in the lands to the east.

Context Sentence JP: マルコ・ポーロの『東方見聞録』はもう読みましたか？
Context Sentence EN: Have you read "The Travels of Marco Polo" by Marco Polo?

Context Sentence JP: 東北で、ボランティアをしていました。
Context Sentence EN: I was volunteering in Tohoku.

Context Sentence JP: 東北で一人ぐらしをしています。
Context Sentence EN: I'm living by myself in Tohoku now.

Context Sentence JP: マグニチュード8.9の地震が、日本の東北地方の海岸を襲った。
Context Sentence EN: A magnitude 8.9 earthquake slammed into Japan’s northeastern coast.

Context Sentence JP: けさ、テレビで中東のニュースを見ました。
Context Sentence EN: I watched the news on the Middle East on TV this morning.

Context Sentence JP: きんきゅうじたいで中東に行かなくてはいけなかったんだから、けっこんしきに来れなかったのは仕方がないよ。
Context Sentence EN: You can't help it that you couldn't make it to the wedding because you had to go to the Middle East for an emergency.

Context Sentence JP: 中東で一番楽しまれているゲームは何ですか？
Context Sentence EN: What is the most played game in the Middle East?

Context Sentence JP: 車は、南東に向かってすすみました。
Context Sentence EN: The car continued heading southeast.

Context Sentence JP: てっきり今日は日が南東にしずむもんだとおもっていたよ。
Context Sentence EN: I totally thought the sun would set in the southeast today.

Context Sentence JP: 南東の方角に、流れ星を見た。
Context Sentence EN: I saw a shooting star in the southeast.

Context Sentence JP: 学こうまで歩くつもりです。
Context Sentence EN: I’m planning to walk to school.

Context Sentence JP: あなたと手をつないで歩くなんて、何年ぶりかしら。
Context Sentence EN: It's the first time we've walked holding hands in a long time.

Context Sentence JP: 私はとても太いので、私が道を歩いている時にペニーを踏んだら、女王様の鼻から鼻くそが飛び出ます。
Context Sentence EN: I’m so fat that when I walk down the street and step on a penny, I squeeze a booger out of the Queen’s nose.

Meaning: To Fix, To Repair, To Fix Something, To Repair Something
Context Sentence JP: パソコンがこわれたんですが、直せますか。
Context Sentence EN: My PC broke. Can you fix it?

Meaning: To Fix, To Repair, To Fix Something, To Repair Something
Context Sentence JP: 考え直した方がいいですよ。
Context Sentence EN: You'd better think it through again.

Meaning: To Fix, To Repair, To Fix Something, To Repair Something
Context Sentence JP: もし壊れていなければ、それを直そうとする必要はないよ。
Context Sentence EN: You don’t need to fix something if it’s not broken.

Context Sentence JP: こしょうした車が直るのはいつですか。
Context Sentence EN: When can I get my broken car fixed?

Context Sentence JP: それでアヤの気げんが直るなら、おれはぜんぜんかまわないよ。
Context Sentence EN: If it makes you feel better, then I don't mind at all, Aya.

Context Sentence JP: 農夫の壊れたトラクターは直った。
Context Sentence EN: The farmer’s broken tractor was fixed.

Context Sentence JP: 川田さんは、とても正直な人です。
Context Sentence EN: Kawata is a very honest person.

Context Sentence JP: かれの正直なところがすきなんです。
Context Sentence EN: I like his honesty.

Context Sentence JP: このひ行きは、東京に直行します。
Context Sentence EN: This airplane is nonstop to Tokyo.

Context Sentence JP: 今日は、日本との会ぎの後、トーフグとのアポに直行します。
Context Sentence EN: Today after the meeting with Japan, I'll go directly to the appointment with Tofugu.

Context Sentence JP: ごめんなさい、今は話せません。トイレへ直行しているところなのです。

Context Sentence JP: このえいがは長かったです。
Context Sentence EN: This movie was long.

Context Sentence JP: あそこのドアの近くに立ってるかみの長い女性が、たん当しゃの方です。
Context Sentence EN: That lady with long hair standing by the door is the one in charge.

Context Sentence JP: 長い距離のランニングを避けるため、自分の足の骨を折ってしまおうと思っている。
Context Sentence EN: I'm thinking about breaking my own legs to avoid going long distance running.

Meaning: Company President, Manager, Director, President Of A Company
Context Sentence JP: 社長は会ぎ中です。
Context Sentence EN: The company president is in a meeting.

Meaning: Company President, Manager, Director, President Of A Company
Context Sentence JP: あの人気サービスのねだんを下げるなんて、トーフグの社長はどうかしてるよ。
Context Sentence EN: The president of Tofugu is insane to lower the price of that popular service.

Context Sentence JP: 全社員は社長のことを嫌っているが、私は単に彼は少し意地悪なだけだと思っている。
Context Sentence EN: All my coworkers hate my boss, but I just think he’s a little mean.

Context Sentence JP: 前は花やで、花やのとなりはさかなやです。
Context Sentence EN: In front is a flower shop and next door to it is a fish shop.

Context Sentence JP: 毎あさ、会社に行く前に、スクワットを五百回します。
Context Sentence EN: Every morning I do 500 squats before leaving for work.

Context Sentence JP: 赤信号の前にいる時、「もうすぐ青に変わるぞ！」と思うとかなり興奮する。
Context Sentence EN: When I’m in front of a red light, I get very excited at the thought of it turning green soon.

Context Sentence JP: このデパートは、午前十じにひらきます。
Context Sentence EN: This department store opens at 10:00 am.

Context Sentence JP: わたしのむす子は、まだ午前中にあさねをするひつようがあります。
Context Sentence EN: My son still needs to take a nap in the morning.

Context Sentence JP: 今日は午前9時にテレパシーで投稿する予定にしているので、もし君がその時何か面白いことを考えたら、それは私の仕業だから。
Context Sentence EN: I’ll be posting telepathically at 9AM today, so if you think of something funny, that was me.

Context Sentence JP: としょかんの南に、交ばんがあります。
Context Sentence EN: There is a police station on the south side of the library.

Context Sentence EN: Why isn't there a North Japan Railway Company and a South Japan Railway Company, even though there's an East Japan Railway Company and a West Japan Railway Company?

Context Sentence JP: 南球場でブラッド・ピットを見た。
Context Sentence EN: I saw Brad Pitt at the south baseball stadium.

Context Sentence JP: あなたの後ろのドアをしめてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please close the door behind you.

Context Sentence JP: チャイルドシートは、かならず後ろのざせきにせっちしてください。
Context Sentence EN: You must install the child carseat on the rear seat of the car.

Context Sentence JP: 振り返って後ろを見た後、さらにもう一度振り返ったら、僕のことが見えるよ。
Context Sentence EN: If you turn around to look behind you and then do it again, you’ll see me.

Context Sentence JP: 後でいっしょにお茶でもしませんか。
Context Sentence EN: Why don’t we have some tea together later?

Context Sentence JP: 後で、「言わんこっちゃない」って言わせないでよ。
Context Sentence EN: Don't make me say, "I told you so," later.

Context Sentence EN: After the movie, we headed across town to watch it again in another theater.

Context Sentence JP: 女の人は、あしたの午後、何をしますか。
Context Sentence EN: What are the women going to do tomorrow afternoon?

Context Sentence JP: 直近の午後で空いているじかんは何じですか？
Context Sentence EN: What's the closest time in the afternoon that's available for an appointment?

Context Sentence EN: I have an appointment with my doctor at 3PM to remove an ingrown toenail.

Context Sentence JP: かれも来ると思いますよ。
Context Sentence EN: I think he’s coming too.

Context Sentence EN: Do you think I should avoid going to Mexico during hurricane season?

Context Sentence JP: 思うだけならまだ違法じゃないよ。
Context Sentence EN: The simple act of thinking is not illegal, yet.

Context Sentence JP: 夜には、星がとてもきれいでした。
Context Sentence EN: That night the stars were really pretty.

Context Sentence JP: 今夜はたくさんながれ星が見れるといいんですが。
Context Sentence EN: I hope we can see a lot of shooting stars tonight.

Context Sentence JP: お父さん、どうして今日は星型のメガネをかけているの？
Context Sentence EN: Dad, why are you wearing star-shaped glasses today?

Context Sentence JP: アメリカと日本の生活のちがいをおしえてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please tell me the difference between American and Japanese life?

Context Sentence JP: あなたとの生活をもう一どやり直したいんです。
Context Sentence EN: I want to get back together and live with you again.

Context Sentence JP: 毎日の生活でアニメを見ながらマシュマロを食べることができたら、とても幸せです。
Context Sentence EN: I would be very happy if I could watch cartoons and eat marshmallows every day of my life.

Context Sentence JP: 海で泳ぎました。
Context Sentence EN: I went swimming in the sea.

Context Sentence JP: 海の公えんで、先生が学生に話しています。
Context Sentence EN: The teacher is talking to her students in Marine Park.

Context Sentence JP: 映画「水の世界」は、実は、海の底に住んでいる超頭のいい魚によって書かれた作品だ。
Context Sentence EN: The movie Water World was actually written by a race of super-intelligent fish that live at the bottom of the ocean.

Context Sentence JP: しょう来は、海外ではたらきたいです。
Context Sentence EN: I want to work overseas in the future.

Context Sentence JP: ほけんぎょうかいに八年つとめた後、アメリカへ海外りゅう学しました。
Context Sentence EN: After having worked in the insurance industry for eight years, I went to America to study abroad.

Context Sentence JP: 私はどこか海外で住みたいと思っているが、旅行は嫌いだ。
Context Sentence EN: I want to live somewhere overseas, but I hate traveling.

Context Sentence JP: ねつが、三十八点九どあります。
Context Sentence EN: I have a fever of 38.9 degrees.

Context Sentence JP: このクローゼットにある二点五ばいのりょうのふくが他のへやにもちらばっています。
Context Sentence EN: Compared to what's in this closet, I have 2.5 times as many clothes scattered around in the other rooms.

Context Sentence JP: あの映画が駄作だったという点ではあなたに同意しますが、時間の無駄だったと気づいたのは映画が終わってからでした。
Context Sentence EN: I agree with your point that the movie was really bad, but I didn’t realize it was such a waste of time until it was over.

Context Sentence JP: かの女のせんもんは、科学です。
Context Sentence EN: Her major is science.

Context Sentence JP: 日本は科学ぎじゅつというめんにおいてとてもすぐれています。
Context Sentence EN: Japan is very advanced in the fields of science and technology.

Context Sentence JP: 我々に蚊除け剤を作らせてくれる科学は、本当に偉大だ。
Context Sentence EN: Science is really amazing because it allowed us to make mosquito repellent.

Context Sentence JP: わたしはお茶をのみませんでした。
Context Sentence EN: I didn’t drink tea.

Context Sentence JP: 死ぬ前に、ベーコンのお茶づけが食べたい。
Context Sentence EN: I want to eat bacon rice covered in tea before I die.

Context Sentence JP: 何故かおならがしたくなるので、もうお茶を飲むことはできない。
Context Sentence EN: I can’t drink tea anymore because it makes me fart.

Context Sentence JP: ★に入るばんごうを、茶色にぬります。
Context Sentence EN: Please color the number that best matches the ★ with brown.

Context Sentence JP: 明るい茶色にカラーリングしてください。
Context Sentence EN: I'd like to dye my hair light brown, please.

Context Sentence JP: 私の白いTシャツ全ての脇のところに、茶色のシミがある。
Context Sentence EN: All of my white t-shirts have brown armpit stains on them.

Context Sentence JP: 毎あさ、なっとうを食べます。
Context Sentence EN: I eat natto every morning.

Context Sentence JP: いつも、けんこうにいいものを食べるじかんがないんです。
Context Sentence EN: I never have enough time to eat healthy foods.

Context Sentence JP: 私は、寝ながら食べるのが好きだ。夢遊病のような感じで、それは夢遊食事病と呼ばれる。
Context Sentence EN: I like to eat while I’m sleeping. It’s just like sleepwalking, but it’s called sleep-eating.

Context Sentence JP: パソコンのしすぎで、首がいたいです。
Context Sentence EN: I’ve been using my computer too much so my neck hurts.

Context Sentence JP: 首をねちがえました。
Context Sentence EN: I cricked my neck in my sleep.

Context Sentence JP: 腺ペストって、首から胸が生えてくる病気のことですか？
Context Sentence EN: Is the bubonic plague the illness that made people grow boobs on their necks?

Context Sentence JP: 足首をひねってしまいました。
Context Sentence EN: I twisted my ankle.

Context Sentence JP: 右の足首がすごくいたいんです！
Context Sentence EN: My right ankle hurts a lot.

Context Sentence JP: 宙に舞う羽から逃げる途中で、足首を捻挫した。
Context Sentence EN: I sprained my ankle while running away from a feather floating in the air.

Meaning: To Get Fired, To Get Sacked
Context Sentence JP: 先月、会社を首になりました。
Context Sentence EN: I was fired from the company last month.

Meaning: To Get Fired, To Get Sacked
Context Sentence JP: しゅう金したお金をつかいこんだら、首になるに決まってるじゃん！
Context Sentence EN: Of course you would get fired, if you used up the collected money.

Context Sentence JP: マーチングバンドを職場に引き連れてきたことが理由で、私は昨日首になりました。
Context Sentence EN: I got sacked yesterday for bringing a marching band into work with me.

Context Sentence JP: だれだって、何かしらの欠点をもってるものさ。
Context Sentence EN: Everyone has some sort of weakness.

Context Sentence JP: そうだ、ちょっと思い出したんだけど、かの女って欠点がないんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: Oh, I just remembered, she doesn't have any faults.

Context Sentence JP: 私は欠点がありすぎるので、絶対にプロのサッカー選手にはなれません。たとえば、私には足がありません。
Context Sentence EN: I’ll never become a professional soccer player because I have too many shortcomings, for example, I don’t have any legs.

Context Sentence JP: やはり、アベ氏のはつげんはいつも全くブレませんね。
Context Sentence EN: As we all know, Mr. Abe’s statements never change.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチ氏とビエト氏はとても気が合う。
Context Sentence EN: Mr. Koichi and Mr. Viet have good chemistry.

Context Sentence JP: おお、ホワイト氏、ちょっと座れば？
Context Sentence EN: Yo, Mr. White, why don’t you just sit down?

Meaning: Full Name, First And Last Name
Context Sentence JP: 自分の氏名ぐらいは、日本ごでかけるようになりたいよね。
Context Sentence EN: You at least want to be able to write your full name in Japanese, right?

Meaning: Full Name, First And Last Name
Context Sentence JP: ごさん考までに、わたしの氏名は、高 一子です。
Context Sentence EN: For your information, my name is Ichiko Ko.

Meaning: Full Name, First And Last Name
Context Sentence JP: そちらの誓約書に氏名をご記入頂ければ、大砲で貴方の頭の上の林檎を撃ちぬいて差し上げます。
Context Sentence EN: If you would please write your first and last name on the waiver, we will proceed with shooting an apple off of your head with a cannon.

Context Sentence JP: 一人ぐらしをはじめて、自由なじかんができました。
Context Sentence EN: I started living by myself and I have some free time to spare.

Context Sentence JP: 自由になるための道のりはまだまだとおいですが、ぜったいにあきらめません。
Context Sentence EN: To obtain freedom, we still have a long way to go, but we will never give up.

Context Sentence EN: The money Japanese salarymen can use freely every month is, on average, usually only 35,000 yen.

Context Sentence JP: とくに理由はありません。
Context Sentence EN: I don’t have any specific reason.

Context Sentence JP: 未だけいひのせいさんをしてないのには、何か理由があるんですか？
Context Sentence EN: Do you have any reason for not having settled your business expenses yet?

Context Sentence JP: 論理的な理由から、彼は行方不明になったゴム手袋の事件の犯人が風船屋であることを導いた。
Context Sentence EN: For logical reasons, he was led to believe that the culprit in the case of the missing rubber gloves was the balloonist.

Context Sentence JP: 一万円札を小ぜににくずしてもらえませんか？
Context Sentence EN: Could you give me change for a 10,000 yen bill?

Context Sentence JP: この二千円札、千円札二枚と両がえしてくれない？
Context Sentence EN: Can you break this 2,000 yen bill to two 1,000 yen bills, please?

Context Sentence EN: "I’m meeting my mom’s father’s daughter’s niece tomorrow at two-thirty in the afternoon." "Why didn’t you just say you’re meeting your older sister for lunch tomorrow? Jeez!"

Context Sentence EN: According to the psychology explanation, it looks like when you are able to say something mean to a person, you're actually being dependent on them.

Context Sentence EN: My major was criminal psychology in college.

Context Sentence EN: I like studying geography by myself too, but it’s more fun to study with my friend.

Context Sentence EN: My American friend is not good at geography at all, so I heard that she used to think Japan was the capital of China until very recently.

Context Sentence JP: これから、みなさんを二組に分けます。
Context Sentence EN: After this, we’ll be splitting into two teams.

Context Sentence JP: オレたちの組はこの辺じゃ有名なんだぜ。
Context Sentence EN: Our group is famous around here.

Context Sentence EN: What time will the next ship leave?

Context Sentence EN: I always feel sea sick when I'm on a boat.

Context Sentence EN: I’m the captain and I run this entire ship by myself.

Context Sentence EN: Even though there is no air in space, I still want to live on the moon.

Context Sentence JP: 雲一つない青空でした。

Context Sentence EN: I'll give you that cloud over there as thanks for when you treated me to a meal.

Context Sentence JP: ねられないとき、羊を数えるのはなぜですか。

Context Sentence EN: If you value your own life, get lost before I count to ten.

Context Sentence EN: There are two students missing, Mr. Smith. I only counted thirty-eight children.

Context Sentence EN: What was the death toll of the 1985 New York earthquake?

Context Sentence EN: In this movie, the role of the math teacher who is good at counting is played by Koichi, who is known for playing the role of numerous older brother figures in countless Japanese films.

Context Sentence EN: Regardless of the increase in numbers, you shouldn’t publish vulgar news stories.

Context Sentence EN: This child is a genius who memorized a 15,672-digit number.

Context Sentence EN: Eleven is the number I always wear when I play volleyball.

Context Sentence EN: As for the chart below, it shows "train times" and "bus times."

Context Sentence EN: Make sure you take the train headed to Ueno and Ikebukuro and not Tokyo and Shinagawa.

Context Sentence JP: ジェットコースターに乗るのは大好きなんだけど、どの席もいつもゲロ臭いんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I love to ride on roller coasters but they always smell like vomit.

Meaning: To Give Someone A Ride, To Place Something On, To Load Something
Context Sentence JP: 子どもを助手せきに乗せるのはきけんです。
Context Sentence EN: It’s dangerous to let children ride in the passenger's seat.

Meaning: To Give Someone A Ride, To Place Something On, To Load Something

Context Sentence EN: Putting your feet on a table is bad manners.

Meaning: To Give Someone A Ride, To Place Something On, To Load Something
Context Sentence JP: 男は、女性の自転車が完璧に壊れているのを見て、「町まで車に乗せてあげるよ」と言った。
Context Sentence EN: The man saw that the woman’s bicycle was completely destroyed so he offered to give her a ride back to town.

Context Sentence JP: お客さんが入ってくると、このベルがなります。
Context Sentence EN: When customers come in, this bell rings.

Context Sentence EN: In this hotel, all the guest rooms have concierge service.

Context Sentence EN: I just finished renovating the guest room. Come over and tell me what you think.

Context Sentence EN: There is a pharmacy and a butcher shop nearby too.

Context Sentence EN: Before I changed my job to being a princess, I was working at a flower shop.

Context Sentence JP: 焼肉屋さんを経営している人と結婚するのが夢です。
Context Sentence EN: It’s my dream to marry someone who owns yakiniku restaurants.

Context Sentence EN: My younger sister cleaned the room.

Context Sentence EN: I heard that there is a room that only appears at night in the music room of my school.

Context Sentence JP: 部屋を片付けようとすると、いつも途中で見つけた別のものに気を取られてしまって、片付けることができません。
Context Sentence EN: I can’t clean my room because whenever I try I just get distracted by all the stuff I find.

Meaning: Butcher Shop, Meat Shop, Meat Store
Context Sentence JP: あそこの肉屋で、合いびき肉を100g買ってきてちょうだい。
Context Sentence EN: Could you buy 100 grams of ground beef and pork from the butcher shop over there?

Meaning: Butcher Shop, Meat Shop, Meat Store
Context Sentence JP: あそこのお肉屋さん、新しいあじのビーガンとうふバーガーをかいはつしてるらしいよ。
Context Sentence EN: I heard that butcher shop is creating a new flavor of vegan tofu burgers.

Meaning: Butcher Shop, Meat Shop, Meat Store
Context Sentence JP: 私の小さな町には「お肉屋さん」とい名前のレストランがあったんだけど、本当の「お肉屋さん」がどんなものかを知った時にはとてもショックでした。それで、今、私はベジタリアンなんです。
Context Sentence EN: My small town had a restaurant called The Butcher Shop, so I was really surprised to learn what a real butcher shop is. I’m a vegetarian now.

Meaning: Tea Shop, Tea Store, Tea House
Context Sentence JP: ポートランドでは、トーフグ茶屋の、ふぐもちが人気です。
Context Sentence EN: The Tofugu tea shop in Portland has popular fugu mochi.

Context Sentence EN: When Koichi traveled to Kyoto, he enjoyed teahouse entertainment every night.

Meaning: Tea Shop, Tea Store, Tea House

Context Sentence EN: Japanese people call modern cafes "Cafe," slightly old fashioned coffee lounges "Kissaten," and traditional tea shops "Chaya."

Meaning: Fish Shop, Fish Market, Fish Dealer, Fish Store, Fishmonger
Context Sentence JP: 魚屋で金目だいを買ってきたの。
Context Sentence EN: We went to buy splendid red bream at the fish store.

Context Sentence EN: This fish shop floor is very slippery, so be careful.

Context Sentence JP: あの魚屋さんは百円おまけをしてくれた。
Context Sentence EN: The fish shop gave me a 100 yen discount.

Context Sentence EN: Nagoya has a lot of delicious food.

Context Sentence EN: I had work in Nagoya today again.

Context Sentence EN: I'm really, really serious about studying Japanese this time.

Context Sentence EN: The bath temperature is just right.

Context Sentence EN: What a coincidence! I was just about to call you!

Context Sentence JP: 毎度おさわがせして、申しわけありません。

Context Sentence EN: Sora can't make up his mind about which one to order, as usual.

Context Sentence JP: 毎度有難う御座います。
Context Sentence EN: Thank you for your continued patronage.

Context Sentence EN: Let’s try looking again from a different angle.

Context Sentence EN: The Leaning Tower of Pisa sure stands at an odd angle.

Context Sentence JP: もしマイリー・サイラスが一番好きな歌を歌っているのをこの角度から見ることができたら、俺の夢を叶えてくれたってことで神様の存在を信じると思う。
Context Sentence EN: If I can see Miley Cyrus singing my favorite song from this angle, I will believe in God because it would mean that He made my dream come true.

Context Sentence EN: My brother has a cold and a fever of 38 degrees Celsius.

Context Sentence EN: What temperature do you usually set the AC to?

Context Sentence JP: ２４度ぐらいがちょうどいいと思うんだけど。
Context Sentence EN: I think about 24 degrees is just right for me.

Meaning: To Hold Something, To Carry Something, To Own Something, To Keep Something

Context Sentence EN: Do you have an eraser, Araki?

Context Sentence EN: Actually, Koichi has a license to be a soft baseball referee ...actually, that's a lie.

Context Sentence JP: 一等に当選したことを知った時、宝くじを持つ手の震えが止まらなかった。
Context Sentence EN: When I realized I won the grand prize, the hand I was holding the lottery ticket with couldn’t help but shake.

Context Sentence EN: However, neither of them exist in this world.

Context Sentence EN: Mt. Fuji is registered as a World Heritage Site.

Context Sentence EN: He lives in his own world and doesn’t want to leave it.

Context Sentence EN: We’ve decided to sell bacon and okonomiyaki cheese tarts from Tofugu this summer.

Context Sentence EN: Portland's famous Tofugu tea, with the dirt of Koichi's nails, is now on sale on the Tofugu website!

Context Sentence EN: I can’t wait until the Tofugu body pillows finally release.

Context Sentence JP: このたんごの発音を教えてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please teach me the pronunciation of this word.

Context Sentence EN: Taylor, your Japanese pronunciation is so good.

Context Sentence EN: Wow, the pronunciation of the Spanish word "una casita" sounds similar to "I’m hungry" in Japanese.

Context Sentence JP: 自たくのベランダで、イモムシを発見しました。
Context Sentence EN: I found hornworms on my balcony.

Context Sentence JP: がんは、早き発見することがひじょうに重ようです。
Context Sentence EN: It’s very important to have early detection for cancer.

Context Sentence EN: I discovered how to make money from Facebook. It’s easy. Just go to your account settings, deactivate your account, and go to work.

Context Sentence EN: The consultation time is from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m.

Context Sentence EN: If you don't mind, I'd like to discuss something with you in private. Do you have a minute?

Context Sentence EN: I consulted my doctor about my hemorrhoids.

Context Sentence EN: First, you will listen closely to what your partner has to say.

Context Sentence EN: According to my fortune, my future partner is a prince in some country. I wonder if it's true.

Context Sentence EN: I don’t want a stupid talking companion.

Context Sentence EN: There are many elementary schools in Nara that require students to wear uniforms.

Context Sentence EN: Thank you for the beautiful scarf. I’ll cherish it.

Context Sentence EN: Princess Kristen's red hair is so beautiful it makes me cry.

Context Sentence EN: Oh my, your eyes are as beautiful as jewels, Christine.

Context Sentence EN: She's beautiful and very elegant.

Context Sentence EN: You should have just told her that she's beautiful.

Context Sentence EN: "Where do you want to eat tonight?" "It’s your call. I lost the rock-paper-scissors."

Context Sentence EN: At the soccer game, we managed to win 1-0.

Context Sentence EN: When I was four, I won the match but I felt like I lost anyway.

Context Sentence EN: I’m entering my pet rabbit in tomorrow’s dog race and I guarantee it's going to win.

Context Sentence JP: 勝者だけが次のステージにすすめます。

Context Sentence EN: Viet emerged the victor in the 72 hour Scrabble game.

Context Sentence EN: I prayed for certain victory at a shrine.

Context Sentence JP: もし虎と七面鳥が戦争することになったら、それはもう虎の必勝になるだろうね。それから、ついでに、養鶏所で働く人も喜ぶだろうね。
Context Sentence EN: If tigers were to go to war against turkeys, it would mean certain victory for the tigers. Chicken farmers would be happy, as well.

Context Sentence EN: The side who has better technology in a war will usually have an easy victory.

Context Sentence EN: I sent a letter to Mr. Smith.

Context Sentence EN: I'll send you the photos later on LINE.

Context Sentence EN: That luggage looks heavy.

Context Sentence EN: This car is so heavy that my arm is about to fall off.

Context Sentence EN: "I’m sorry I stepped on your foot." "No problem. It was a little heavy, but no harm done."

Context Sentence JP: 重要なしょるいなので、なくさないよう注意してください。
Context Sentence EN: They’re important documents, so please be careful not to lose them.

Context Sentence EN: For this country, it is very important that each citizen raises one swan.

Context Sentence EN: The most important thing in my life is beer? I didn’t say that! Don’t put words in my mouth.

Context Sentence EN: What is Anna’s body weight in kilograms?

Context Sentence EN: I can’t wait to weigh myself at my next body measuring.

Context Sentence JP: どうして私があなたの体重を知っているのか聞かないで。ジェシカが口を滑らせたことは絶対に誰にも言わないって、あの子と約束したんだから。
Context Sentence EN: Don’t ask me how I know your weight. I promised Jessica that I wouldn’t tell you that she told me.

Context Sentence EN: Please draw double lines under kanji you don’t know.

Context Sentence EN: Japan doesn't allow dual citizenship.

Context Sentence EN: What is necessary to pass the JET interview?

Meaning: Main Point, Gist, Main Idea, Essence

Context Sentence EN: Even if Koichi said, "Tofugu is female," I believe many users would have opposing opinions.

Context Sentence EN: Supposing the worst were to happen to Tofugu, what would happen to lifetime members?

Context Sentence EN: For example, if we say one dollar is one hundred yen, then one can of $1 coca cola is one hundred yen, right?

Context Sentence EN: Since seeing that pile of money on her bed, crazy assumptions have been flying around in my head.

Meaning: To Wake Up, To Get Up, To Occur

Context Sentence EN: My father gets up at six o’clock every morning.

Context Sentence EN: You're always up so early! It's still 4 o'clock, you know.

Context Sentence EN: I do 100 sit-ups every morning right after waking up to get rid of my three pack.

Context Sentence EN: I used it immediately.

Context Sentence JP: 東きゅう電鉄によりますと、東きゅう東よこ線は人身じこのえいきょうで、げんざい運転を見合わせています。
Context Sentence EN: According to the Tokyu Corporation, the Tokyu Toyoko line has currently suspended operations due to an accident involving personal injury.

Context Sentence JP: 電鉄会社ではたらくのがゆめです。
Context Sentence EN: My dream is to work for an electric railroad company.

Context Sentence JP: 「はい、どうぞ。あなたが好きな阪急電鉄の写真よ。」「うわぁ！やったぁ！俺の大好きな阪急電鉄じゃん！」
Context Sentence EN: "Here you are, dear. Some of those Hankyu Railway pictures you like." "Oh wow, I absolutely love the Hankyu Railway!"

Context Sentence JP: でも、日本の歌はあまり知りません。
Context Sentence EN: But I don’t know Japanese songs very well.

Context Sentence JP: これはたんなる歌じゃなく、ひみつのあん号でもあるんじゃないかという気がしています。
Context Sentence EN: It feels like this isn't just a song, but a secret code too.

Context Sentence JP: 「ジェイソン！あんた、アマンダのために歌を作ったの？」「えーと、これはそういうのじゃないんだ。」「もう！とぼけないでよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Jason! You made a song for Amanda?" "Ah, this isn’t what it looks like." "Come on! Don’t give me that."

Context Sentence JP: 歌手になったのは、母のえいきょうが大きいです。
Context Sentence EN: My mother had a large influence in my becoming a singer.

Context Sentence JP: あの歌手、かなり日やけしたね。
Context Sentence EN: That singer got quite a tan, didn't she?

Context Sentence JP: 子どもの頃は、歌手だったのよ。なんちゃってね。今でも歌手なんですけど。
Context Sentence EN: I used to be a singer when I was kid. Well, who am I kidding, I’m still a singer now.

Context Sentence JP: 明日の算数のじゅぎょう、定ぎと分度きわすれずにね！
Context Sentence EN: Don’t forget a ruler and a protractor for math class tomorrow.

Context Sentence JP: 立ち入ったことをお聞きしますが、よみ・かき・算数、どれが一番とくいですか？
Context Sentence EN: I need to ask you a personal question. Between reading, writing and arithmetic, which one are you the best at?

Context Sentence JP: 「連絡するのに時間がかかっちゃってごめんなさい。最近、仕事で忙しかったものだから。」「君の仕事って何だっけ？」「小学校の算数の先生よ。」
Context Sentence EN: "I’m sorry it took me so long to get back to you. I’ve been tied up with work." "What was your job again?" "I’m a math teacher at an elementary school."

Meaning: To Hear, To Ask, To Listen
Context Sentence JP: テキストを聞きます。
Context Sentence EN: We are going to listen to the text.

Meaning: To Hear, To Ask, To Listen
Context Sentence JP: この日本語は分からないから先生に聞きましょう。
Context Sentence EN: Let's ask the teacher since we don't understand this Japanese.

Meaning: To Hear, To Ask, To Listen
Context Sentence JP: ねえ、聞いて、エイミー。これはあなたのせいじゃないわ。だって、ケンカしたからって、他の人と寝ていい正当な理由にはならないでしょ。
Context Sentence EN: Listen to me, Amy. This is not your fault. He is not justified in sleeping with someone else just because you two had a fight.

Context Sentence JP: 父は、毎朝新聞を読みます。
Context Sentence EN: My father reads the newspaper every morning.

Context Sentence JP: この新聞すっげー専門用語だらけじゃん。スコットがこの新聞を何回も読まなきゃいけないのは当然だな。
Context Sentence EN: This newspaper is so highbrow. No wonder Scott had to read it so many times.

Context Sentence JP: いいですか。英語じゃなくて日本語ですよ。
Context Sentence EN: Okay? Not English, Japanese.

Context Sentence JP: 今ワニカニを買うと、もれなく日本語でかかれたトーフグのサインが付いてきますよ。

Context Sentence JP: 間違うことを恐れるなよ。日本語で喋ってみろって。やってみろよ。君ならできると思うよ。
Context Sentence EN: Don’t be afraid of making mistakes. Speak in Japanese. Give it a shot. I think you can do it.

Reading: ふらんすご, フランスご

Context Sentence EN: My daughter can speak both French and English.

Context Sentence EN: In many African countries, both English and French are used as their official languages.

Context Sentence EN: Learning French is too difficult! I can’t take it anymore. Give me a break!

Reading: すぺいんご, スペインご

Context Sentence EN: There’s a Spanish quiz tomorrow!

Context Sentence EN: That Spanish textbook is currently sold out, so it's not available.

Context Sentence JP: ニンニクはスペイン語で「ajo」っていうんだけど、「アホ」って発音されるんだよ。「アホ」は日本語で「stupid」って意味だよ。
Context Sentence EN: Garlic in Spanish is "ajo," which is pronounced "aho." "Aho" means "stupid" in Japanese.

Context Sentence JP: 主語をハッキリさせてくれないかな。
Context Sentence EN: Can you make the subject clear?

Context Sentence EN: This new service that clarifies the subject is very useful.

Context Sentence EN: Japanese is a subject-object-verb language whereas English is a subject-verb-object language.

Context Sentence JP: 次の文を読んで、しつもんに答えてください。
Context Sentence EN: Please read the following text and answer the questions.

Context Sentence EN: I can’t read sheet music.

Context Sentence JP: 今夜、あの新しい洒落た日本食レストランに行こうよ。知ってた？あそこには、ホーホケキョと美しい声で鳴く鶯も何羽かいるんだぜ。
Context Sentence EN: Let’s go to the new, chic Japanese restaurant tonight. Did you know that it has a few cute Japanese bush warblers singing with their beautiful voices?

Context Sentence EN: You really thought this line was perfect? It’s not even close to straight!

Context Sentence JP: きっ茶店の横に、食どうがあります。

Context Sentence JP: もし強とうがトーフグのオフィスにやって来たら、コウイチのデスクまで走ってその横にしゃがみこむんだ。そこが最も安全な場所だからね。
Context Sentence EN: If a robber breaks into the Tofugu office, just run to Koichi's desk and crouch down next to it because it's the safest spot.

Context Sentence EN: I’ll keep doing my best!

Context Sentence EN: This afternoon, I looked up things about the war at the library.

Context Sentence JP: カピバラが食べられるのかどうか、ちょっと調べてくれない？
Context Sentence EN: Can you research capybaras and see if they are edible?

Context Sentence EN: My parents moved near the hospital last week.

Context Sentence JP: うちの親、かほごすぎると思うんだよね。
Context Sentence EN: I think my parents are overprotective.

Context Sentence EN: This is so unfair! Midori gets everything that I want. And, on top of that, she doesn’t have my mom and dad for parents.

Context Sentence JP: まだ親しい友人にしか話してないの。
Context Sentence EN: I've only told this to close friends.

Context Sentence EN: They say, "A hedge between keeps friendship green," right? We're good friends, but don't peek at me when I'm on the toilet.

Context Sentence EN: Oh Koichi. Calm down. I’ll ask my close friends if anyone can lend you the 80 cents.

Context Sentence JP: いつも親切にしていただいて、ありがとうございます。
Context Sentence EN: Thank you for always being kind.

Context Sentence EN: I've never seen a company as kind as Tofugu.

Context Sentence EN: Oh my gosh, this is the best cheesecake I have ever had. You're so kind, so I'm sure you'll give me the last piece, right?

Context Sentence JP: ま、親友には反対されたんですけどね。
Context Sentence EN: Well, I was objected to by a close friend.

Context Sentence EN: Koichi and Viet are good friends. They are more than friends, but not lovers.

Meaning: Close Friend, Best Friend, Good Friend
Context Sentence JP: 「ねぇ、知ってる？サラがベスと付き合ってるのよ。」「え、知らなかった。サラのこと親友だと思ってたけど、私そのこと何も聞いてないわ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Hey, you know what? Sara is going out with Beth." "What? I didn’t know that. I thought she was my best friend but she never told me about that."

Context Sentence JP: 頭をあらってあげましょう。
Context Sentence EN: I’ll wash your head.

Context Sentence EN: Taking a nap usually refreshes my mind.

Context Sentence JP: 頭が痛いので、喋らないでください。
Context Sentence EN: I have a headache so please stop talking.

Context Sentence EN: I already forgot the face of the travel agent I met yesterday.

Context Sentence JP: コウイチって、顔がこいよね？
Context Sentence EN: Koichi has very defined facial features, don't you think?

Context Sentence EN: "Hey, buddy. Are you picking a fight with me? Why are you staring at me like that?" "Well, your face looks really pale. Are you okay?"

Context Sentence EN: Boy, have you ever grown up, young man. You are the spitting image of your father.

Context Sentence EN: My mother’s illness still hasn’t improved.

Context Sentence EN: I got a disease that makes me fart all the time, so I've haven't been able to go outside.

Context Sentence JP: 「先生、僕のママの病気、直せるの？」「やってみるけど、当てにしないでね。」
Context Sentence EN: "Can you fix my mom’s illness, doctor?" "I’ll give it a try, but don’t count on it."

Context Sentence EN: I suffer from Ménière’s disease, so I often get dizzy.

Context Sentence JP: ぼくがワニカニレベル1から全ぜん進めないのはきっと外国語できない病にかかったからにちがいない。
Context Sentence EN: The reason I haven't been able to get further than Level 1 on WaniKani must be because I have "can't-learn-foreign-language" syndrome.

Context Sentence JP: 彼の言ったことを大袈裟に考えないで。難病で苦しんでるなんて明らかに嘘なんだから。
Context Sentence EN: Don’t make a big deal out of what he said. It’s definitely a lie that he’s suffering from an incurable disease.

Context Sentence JP: うつったらいやだから、病人には近よりたくない。
Context Sentence EN: If you don’t want to catch something, you shouldn’t go near sick people.

Context Sentence JP: うらないしに、前世は病人だったと言われました。
Context Sentence EN: The fortuneteller told me that my previous life was as a sick person.

Context Sentence JP: 「調子はどうだい？」「絶好調だよ。」「それは良かった。病人からその言葉を聞けるとは思ってもみなかったがな。」
Context Sentence EN: "How’s it going?" "Couldn’t be better." "Good. I’m surprised to hear that from a sick person though."

Context Sentence JP: げしとは、一年で最も夜がみじかくなる日のことだ。
Context Sentence EN: The summer solstice is the shortest night of the year.

Context Sentence JP: ふじ山は日本で最も高い山です。
Context Sentence EN: Mt. Fuji is the tallest mountain in Japan.

Context Sentence JP: 彼、今日の夜何食べたか知ってる？焼き肉食べ放題に行ったんだよ。最も臭いおならに備えておいた方が身のためだよ。用心に越したことはないんだから。
Context Sentence EN: Do you know what he ate tonight? He went to an all you can eat yakiniku restaurant. We’d better prepare for the smelliest farts imaginable. Better safe than sorry.

Meaning: The Best, Best, Supreme, The Most, Most

Context Sentence EN: Beer when work ends is the best.

Meaning: The Best, Best, Supreme, The Most, Most
Context Sentence JP: 東京わんの夜けいを見ながら最高の一時を楽しんでいます。

Meaning: The Best, Best, Supreme, The Most, Most
Context Sentence JP: 「うわ！あんたの作ったの、今までで最高のチョコレートケーキだわ。でも、一体どうしちゃったの？お菓子作りなんてしたことなかったじゃない。」「別に。何か新しいことをしてみたかっただけだよ。」
Context Sentence EN: "Wow, you made the best chocolate cake. But, what’s gotten into you? You’ve never baked before." "Nothing, I just wanted to do something new."

Context Sentence JP: お前に金をやるのは、これが最後だ。
Context Sentence EN: This is the last time I give you money.

Context Sentence JP: うちのつま、いつも最後に一言多いんですよね。
Context Sentence EN: My wife always ends up with one word too many.

Context Sentence JP: とにかく、最後まで聞いてよ。そうすれば分かるから。
Context Sentence EN: At any rate, just listen until the end. Then you’ll understand.

Context Sentence EN: How many books has she read recently?

Context Sentence EN: I can't follow the latest fashion trends anymore.

Context Sentence EN: The term "Gozaru" doesn’t seem to be used as much lately.

Context Sentence EN: I took a forty-two day trip around Southeast Asia.

Context Sentence EN: The French gourmet had 42 plates of Sara udon in May only.

Context Sentence JP: そぼがトイレットペーパーを四十二ロールもかってきた。
Context Sentence EN: My grandma bought forty-two rolls of toilet paper.

Context Sentence EN: This village's population is only 23.

Context Sentence JP: じぶんのまちの人口をしらないにほんじんはおおい。

Context Sentence EN: This calf is very energetic.

Context Sentence JP: それから、ゆうびんきょくへいって、切手をかいます。
Context Sentence EN: Then I’m going to go to the post office and buy stamps.

Context Sentence JP: あの外人さんは切手を一万まいもかっていったよ。
Context Sentence EN: That foreigner bought 10,000 postage stamps.

Context Sentence EN: Since I lost her, I've lost interest in stamp collecting.

Context Sentence EN: The battle to determine the best pickup truck in America is currently a draw between Toyota and Ford.

Context Sentence EN: I was so upset that our rock-paper-scissors game ended in a three way tie.

Meaning: To Pass Away, To Become Deceased, To Die

Context Sentence EN: I heard that Matsumoto passed away.

Context Sentence EN: My younger sister died of pneumonia when she was five.

Context Sentence EN: If my mom passes away, the person who makes food for me will be gone.

Context Sentence JP: 人生ってすばらしい。
Context Sentence EN: Life is wonderful.

Context Sentence JP: 人生オワタ ＼(＾o＾)／
Context Sentence EN: My life is over. ＼(＾o＾)／

Context Sentence JP: 人生はバナナのようなものさ。どれだけながいのかだれもしらないのさ。

Context Sentence EN: That boy has so much energy. He just threw twenty eggs at his aunt’s head and managed to run away.

Context Sentence JP: キャベツに毛虫がついていました。

Context Sentence EN: I thought it was a caterpillar, but it was actually my sister's fake eyelashes.

Context Sentence EN: Sometimes kanji are selected solely for their sounds and the meaning is ignored as in 亜米利加 (アメリカ). These are called phonetic kanji.

Context Sentence EN: Beyond that point, the road enters the mountains.

Context Sentence JP: 今夜は火星と土星が見えるよ！
Context Sentence EN: Mars and Saturn will be visible tonight!

Context Sentence JP: 火星には水がありますか？
Context Sentence EN: Is there water on Mars?

Context Sentence JP: オリンポス山は、火星にある火山の名です。
Context Sentence EN: Olympus Mons is the name of a volcano on Mars.

Context Sentence JP: いつか、木星に行きたいと思っています。
Context Sentence EN: I'd like to go to Jupiter someday.

Context Sentence JP: 火星と木星のあいだには、何がありますか。
Context Sentence EN: What is there between Mars and Jupiter?

Context Sentence JP: 木星や土星はこうして生まれたんですよ。
Context Sentence EN: This is how planets like Jupiter and Saturn were born.

Meaning: One's Origin, One's Hometown, One's Birthplace
Context Sentence JP: どこの出身ですか。
Context Sentence EN: Where are you from?

Meaning: One's Origin, One's Hometown, One's Birthplace
Context Sentence JP: 私たちは二人とも中国出身です。
Context Sentence EN: We are both originally from China.

Meaning: One's Origin, One's Hometown, One's Birthplace
Context Sentence JP: 夕べのパーティーに、同じ出身の人がいました。
Context Sentence EN: At the party last night, there was someone from my hometown.

Context Sentence JP: このUFOは、今、高度3万3000フィートのところにいる。
Context Sentence EN: This UFO is now at an altitude of 33,000 feet.

Context Sentence JP: マイケルは、高度なテクニックを使って、むずかしいゲームを次々クリアした。
Context Sentence EN: Michael used advanced techniques to complete one difficult game after another.

Context Sentence JP: 高度を上げすぎると空気がうすくなって、エンジンがフレームアウトしちゃうんだよ。
Context Sentence EN: If the altitude is too high, the air becomes too thin and it'll cause the engine to flame out.

Context Sentence JP: こちらに回答を入力してください。
Context Sentence EN: Please enter your answer here.

Context Sentence JP: ご回答お待ちしています。

Context Sentence JP: アンケートへの回答、ありがとうございました。
Context Sentence EN: Thank you for your response to the survey.

Context Sentence JP: クマは山から人里に出てくることがある。
Context Sentence EN: Bears sometimes come out of the mountains into human habitations.

Context Sentence JP: ここは人里はなれたところだな。
Context Sentence EN: We're in the middle of nowhere, huh?

Context Sentence JP: 人里はなれた山の中からは、月が明るく見える。
Context Sentence EN: The moon was brightly visible from the middle of the remote mountains.

Context Sentence JP: PDFの次頁がエラーになって見れません。
Context Sentence EN: I cannot see the next page of the PDF because of an error.

Context Sentence JP: 全頁カラーのマンガをかきました。
Context Sentence EN: I drew a full-page color manga.

Context Sentence JP: 毎日一頁ずつ読み進めた。
Context Sentence EN: I read through one page each day.

Context Sentence JP: 大体、二分くらいかかります。
Context Sentence EN: It generally takes about two minutes.

Context Sentence JP: 十五分休みましょうか。
Context Sentence EN: Shall we rest for fifteen minutes?

Context Sentence JP: その一年生はベッドの下に四十五分もかくれている。
Context Sentence EN: That first year student has been hiding under the bed for forty-five minutes.

Context Sentence JP: 十六年ぶりの社長交代です。
Context Sentence EN: This is the first change of company president in sixteen years.

Context Sentence JP: ラグビーなど、多くのスポーツで交代のルールがあります。
Context Sentence EN: In many sports, such as rugby, there are rules for substitution.

Context Sentence JP: 交代の時に来なかったし、電話をかけても出ないんだ。
Context Sentence EN: He didn't show up for his shift, and he doesn't answer his phone when I call him.

Context Sentence JP: 大学では空手をやっているんですか。
Context Sentence EN: Are you doing karate at university?

Context Sentence JP: その女の子は空手の先生になりたいと思っていた。
Context Sentence EN: The girl wanted to be a karate teacher.

Context Sentence JP: 子どもでも大人でも空手を学ぶことができます。
Context Sentence EN: Both children and adults can learn karate.

Meaning: Going To The Office, Arriving At The Office, Coming To Work
Context Sentence JP: 今日は、八時に出社しました。

Context Sentence JP: もう出社しているはずなのに。

Meaning: The Others, Other, Other Than That
